metadata.Title: CVE-2021-38496 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
During operations on MessageTasks, a task may have been removed while it was still scheduled, resulting in memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78.15, Thunderbird < 91.2, Firefox ESR < 91.2, Firefox ESR < 78.15, and Firefox < 93.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38496` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 93.0+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '93.0+build1-0ubuntu2').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
